labels.analysis: The MCP Server is primarily a file management tool focused on handling .txt files on the desktop. It provides basic operations like counting, listing, and creating text files. Additionally, it includes a tool for retrieving weather alerts in the US, which is somewhat unrelated to its core file management functionality.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is chosen based on the server's core functionality of managing text files on the desktop (File Management). The secondary label is Weather due to the presence of the weather alerts tool. No custom label is needed as the predefined labels adequately cover the functionality.

tools.name: count_desktop_txt_files
tools.description: Count the number of .txt files on the desktop.

tools.name: list_desktop_txt_files
tools.description: Get a list of all .txt filenames on the desktop.

tools.name: create_desktop_txt_file
tools.description:
Create a new .txt file on the desktop using shell command.
    
    Args:
        filename: The name of the file to create (without .txt extension)
        content: Optional content to write to the file
        ctx: MCP Context object for user interaction
    
    Returns:
        A message indicating success or failure

tools.name: get_alerts
tools.description:
Get weather alerts for a US state.

    Args:
        state: Two-letter US state code (e.g. CA, NY)

server_info_crawled.name: Desktop TXT File Manager
server_info_crawled.author: @YingHe-1/yhfirstmcpserver
server_info_crawled.overview: Manage your desktop TXT files effortlessly. Count, list, and create TXT files with user-friendly interactions. Simplify your file management tasks on your desktop with this intuitive tool.

tools.name: count_desktop_txt_files

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@YingHe-1/yhfirstmcpserver/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
